Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393355) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393355)
